projects.title: ERA NET Project 14.618.21.0003 Development of flexible hybrid heterojunction nanostructures for optoelectronics
projects.description: My role in this project was to improve efficiency of flexible solar cells by application of a flexible antireflective coating (ARC). The material for the coating, PMMA, was selected due to its exceptional optical properties. Soft lithography was used to allow patterning of large areas with periodic microscale structures.

projects.title: Skoltech STRIP Components for stretchable skin-like electronics. Milestone 1 - RFID Antenna for  Temperature Sensor Prototyping
projects.description: The project is dedicated to investigation in the field of materials for flexible electronics. Carbon nanotubes, silver nanowires and thin films of noble metals. Each material was tested for its mechanical, electrical and optical properties as well as put to SEM, TEM and AFM imaging to evaluate the optimal technological regimes of deposition. These results were used to elaborate application notes for corresponding materials. Prototypes of active RFID antennas were prepared with different materials and techniques and examined for their electrical properties.  A flexible temperature sensor was designed to take advantage of the flexible antenna.

projects.title: Static and Dynamic Investigation of  Silver Nanowires
projects.description: SEM and TEM static and dynamic investigations were conducted to assess silver nanowires as a potential material for flexible electronics.

projects.title: Investigation and research on techniques of formation of nanostructurized ZnO and VOx films for sensitive elements in gas sensors
projects.description:
During the research, pulsed laser deposition based technique of formation of ZnO and VOx films was developed and tested. The proceedings of the research were published in Applied Mechanics and Materials in the article “Research of influence thickness of nanocrystalline VOx  films on their electrical properties”.
My role: Nanoscale quality measurements of ZnO and VOx films by AFM. Collaboration on band structure model for ZnO nanoscale films.

projects.title: Study of electrical properties of nanostructured materials and composites based on them for use in gas sensors sensitive elements
projects.description:
During the research prospective functional materials for gas sensing devices and respective methods of formation were assessed. As the conclusion of the research, nanostructured ZnO and VOx films were proven to be gas sensitive and applicable to gas sensing devices.
My role: Nanodiagnostics of thin metal and metal-oxide films by AFM.

projects.title: Investigation of processes of formation and diagnostics of nanobiochips based on convergent technologies for hybrid microfluidics systems
projects.description:
During the research methods of formation of lab on a chips on solid surfaces of SiOx were investigated.
A new model of FIB and AFM treatment was applied.
My role: Research and investigation on application of AFM and FIB treatment in formation of microfluidic devices for Si/SiOx lab on a chip structures.

projects.title: Research on development process of nanostructurized ZnO films formed by laser impulse deposition for sensing devices
projects.description:
During the research a method of formation of nanostructurized ZnO films was applied and investigated. 
A method of formation of nanostructurized ZnO films was investigated, experimental results formed a base for an empirical model of the process. 
My role: AFM-based investigation of quality and grain structure of ZnO films.
